monitor.title: Monitor

name.title: Preset name

regions:cycle.description: Load the next preset from a preset cycle.

presets.title: Presets

regions:highlight.description: Highlight the active regions for a short time
regions:highlight.detailedDescription: Use this to quickly get an overview over the currently active regions.

monitor.title: Monitor

timeout.title: Timeout in milliseconds
timeout.description: Number of milliseconds to wait before hiding the highlight.

mouse:position.description: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.
mouse:position.detailedDescription: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.

position.title: Position
position.description: Coordinates where the mouse cursor should be placed. Accepts absolute units (pixels) or relative units (percent). In case of relative units, they are measured relative to either the entire desktop, the selected monitor or the selected window.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: The monitor to place the mouse cursor relative to.

window.title: Window
window.description:
The window to place the mouse cursor relative to. Defaults to no window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

window:move.detailedDescription: Moves the current foreground window (or a specific window using the /Window switch).

window.title: Window
window.description:
Defaults to the current foreground window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: `\[process name]\[window class]\[window title]`. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

virtualDesktop.title: Virtual desktop
virtualDesktop.description: The virtual desktop number to move the window to. The active virtual desktop will switch as a side effect.

region.title: Region
region.description:
Which region should the window be put in?

Specify regions by using monitor-relative coordinates separated by a comma, starting at 0,0 for the top left corner. The first number is position on the X-axis, the second is Y-axis.

You can specify units, e.g. "30px,50%" for 30px from the left edge, 50% from the top. The supported units are px and %.

Specific English words are also recognized, so you can put "bottom right" or "center" as values here.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description:
Defaults to the monitor the window is currently on.

You can find monitors by specifying their number, their monitor handle (HMONITOR, as hexadecimal, formatted as 0xdeadbeef), or by their exact device name ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serial number or friendly name.

direction.title: Direction
direction.description: Which direction to move the window.

swap.title: Swap with windows in destination region

number.title: Position number

window:transparency.description: Set the transparency of a window.
window:transparency.detailedDescription:
Set the transparency of a selected window.

Note that changing the window transparency can make a window unusable (because you cannot see things that are really there), and should be used with caution. If you accidentally set a window to be transparent when you didn't mean to, the transparency will disappear whenever the affected window is closed and reopened.

amount.title: Transparency amount
amount.description: How transparent should the window be? Ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (completely opaque).

ui:open.detailedDescription: Open a MaxTo window of your choosing.

window.title: Window
window.description: The MaxTo window to open.

ui:close.detailedDescription: Close a MaxTo window of your choosing.

window.title: Window
window.description: The MaxTo window to close.

ui:notify.description: Show a notification bubble to the end user.
ui:notify.detailedDescription: Shows a notification bubble in the notification area (Action Center on Windows 10) with a custom title and text.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the notification bubble.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text of the notification bubble.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the message. This affects the display style of the message.

settings:set.detailedDescription: Change a MaxTo setting. You can only change simple settings, such as numbers, strings or boolean values.

setting.title: Setting
setting.description: Which setting to toggle. Should be a path into the config.json structure, separated by periods; e.g. behavior.passiveMode.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Quickly turn on, off or toggle boolean values.

value.title: Value
value.description: Must be a valid value for the setting you are setting. Values will be attempted to be coerced to the correct data type, so passing the string 'true' to a boolean setting will work.

uncategorized:launch.detailedDescription: Launch another program with a given set of parameters.

executable.title: Program
executable.description: The program to launch. Must be a file on disk. Environment variables are supported.

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: Any arguments to pass to the program.

waitForInputIdle.title: Wait for program to be ready
waitForInputIdle.description: Waits for the program to start its message loop, indicating that the program is ready.

waitForWindow.title: Window to wait for
waitForWindow.description: Wait for the process to create a main window that has a window class that matches this parameter exactly, or has a window title that case-insensitively contains this parameter.

waitForExit.title: Wait for program to exit
waitForExit.description: Wait for the program to finish executing before continuing.

skipIfAlreadyRunning.title: Do not launch if process is already running
skipIfAlreadyRunning.description: Set this flag if you do not want to run a second instance of this process. If you set this flag, MaxTo will first check to see if the process is already running, and only launch a new process if no existing process can be found. Note that MaxTo will use the full path of the executable to check if the process is running.

bringToFront.title: Bring to front
bringToFront.description: Force the window to be the foreground window. May be useful when used in combination with other commands.

timeout.title: Timeout in seconds
timeout.description: How long to wait when waiting for program to be ready or for it to exit. Note that if you specify both to wait for the program to be ready and for it to exit, the total wait time can be two times the timeout value.

license:apply.detailedDescription: Applies a MaxTo license key immediately.

license:status.description: Get the details about the current license. License key is not returned.
license:status.detailedDescription: Get the details about the current license. License key is not returned.

window.title: Window
window.description:
Defaults to the current foreground window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Accepts a list of relative rectangles, separated by pipe characters.

number.title: Position number
number.description: Allow you always select a specific position number. E.g. the top left position has 3 possible placements that it cycles between. Specifying "2" here will disable cycling and always select the last position (top left, two thirds wide).

If you accidentally set a window to be transparent when you didn't mean to, the transparency will disappear whenever the affected window is closed and reopened.

amount.description: How transparent should the window be? Ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (completely opaque).

waitForExit.title: Wait for program to exit

skipIfAlreadyRunning.title: Do not launch if process is already running
skipIfAlreadyRunning.description: Set this flag if you do not want to run a second instance of this process. If you set this flag, MaxTo will first check to see if the process is already running, and only launch a new process if no existing process can be found. Note that MaxTo will use the full path of the executable to check if the process is running.

bringToFront.title: Bring to front
bringToFront.description: Force the window to be the foreground window. May be useful when used in combination with other commands.

timeout.title: Timeout in seconds
timeout.description: How long to wait when waiting for program to be ready or for it to exit. Note that if you specify both to wait for the program to be ready and for it to exit, the total wait time can be two times the timeout value.

window.description:
The window to place the mouse cursor relative to. Defaults to no window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

window.description:
Standardeinstellung für das aktuelle Vordergrund-Fenster

Sie können Fenster anhand des genauen Fenstertitels, der genauen Fensterklasse oder des Fensterhandles (in hexadezimaler Form, formatiert als "0xdeadbeef") suchen.

virtualDesktop.title: Virtueller Desktop
virtualDesktop.description: Die virtuelle Desktopnummer, zu der das Fenster verschoben werden soll. Der aktive virtuelle Desktop wechselt als Nebeneffekt.

region.title: Region
region.description:
In welche Region soll das Fenster eingefügt werden?

Geben Sie Regionen an, indem Sie relative Koordinaten verwenden, die durch ein Komma voneinander getrennt sind, beginnend mit 0,0 für die linke obere Ecke. Die erste Zahl ist die Position auf der X-Achse, die zweite ist die Y-Achse.

Sie können Einheiten angeben, z. "30px, 50%" für 30px vom linken Rand, 50% vom oberen Rand. Die unterstützten Einheiten sind px und %.

Bestimmte englische Wörter werden ebenfalls erkannt, daher können Sie hier "bottom right" oder "center" verwenden.

Por defecto para todos los monitores.

Puede encontrar los monitores especificando su número, su apodo de monitor (HMONITOR, como hexadecimal, formateado como 0xdeadbeef) o por su numero exacto de dispositivo ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), número de serie o nombre descriptivo.

timeout.title: Tiempo de espera en milisegundos
timeout.description: Número de milisegundos que se esperan antes de ocultar el área destacada.

mouse:position.description: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.
mouse:position.detailedDescription: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.

position.title: Position
position.description: Coordinates where the mouse cursor should be placed. Accepts absolute units (pixels) or relative units (percent). In case of relative units, they are measured relative to either the entire desktop, the selected monitor or the selected window.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: The monitor to place the mouse cursor relative to.

window.title: Window
window.description:
The window to place the mouse cursor relative to. Defaults to no window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

window:move.detailedDescription: Mueve la ventana de primer plano actual (o una ventana específica usando el conmutador /Ventana).

window.title: Ventana
window.description:
Por defecto para el monitor en el que la ventana está actualmente activa.

Puede encontrar ventanas especificando el título de ventana exacto, la clase de ventana exacta o el apodo de la ventana (en hexadecimal, formateado como "0xdeadbeef").

virtualDesktop.title: Escritorio virtual
virtualDesktop.description: El número de escritorio virtual al que se va a mover la ventana. El escritorio virtual actual se activará como un efecto secundario.

region.title: Área
region.description:
¿En qué área debe colocarse la ventana?

Especifique las áreas usando coordenadas con referencia al monitor separadas por una coma, comenzando por 0,0 para la esquina superior izquierda. El primer número es la posición en el eje X, el segundo es la posición en el eje Y.

Puede especificar unidades, p. ej., "30 px, 50 %" para 30 px desde el borde izquierdo, 50 % desde la parte superior. Las unidades soportadas son px y %.

También se reconocen palabras inglesas específicas, por lo que puede introducir "bottom right" (parte superior derecha) o "center" (centro) como valores aquí.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description:
Por defecto para el monitor en el que la ventana está actualmente activa.

Puede encontrar monitores especificando su número, su apodo de monitor (HMONITOR, como hexadecimal, formateado como 0xdeadbeef) o por su nombre exacto de dispositivo  ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), número de serie o nombre descriptivo.

direction.title: Dirección
direction.description: En qué dirección mover la ventana.

swap.title: Alternar con ventanas en el área de destino

number.title: Position number
number.description: Allow you always select a specific position number. E.g. the top left position has 3 possible placements that it cycles between. Specifying "2" here will disable cycling and always select the last position (top left, two thirds wide).

window:transparency.description: Set the transparency of a window.
window:transparency.detailedDescription:
Set the transparency of a selected window.

Note that changing the window transparency can make a window unusable (because you cannot see things that are really there), and should be used with caution. If you accidentally set a window to be transparent when you didn't mean to, the transparency will disappear whenever the affected window is closed and reopened.

amount.title: Transparency amount
amount.description: How transparent should the window be? Ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (completely opaque).

title.description: The title of the notification bubble.

text.title: Text

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the message. This affects the display style of the message.

settings:set.detailedDescription: Change a MaxTo setting. You can only change simple settings, such as numbers, strings or boolean values.

setting.title: Setting
setting.description: Which setting to toggle. Should be a path into the config.json structure, separated by periods; e.g. behavior.passiveMode.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Quickly turn on, off or toggle boolean values.

value.title: Value
value.description: Must be a valid value for the setting you are setting. Values will be attempted to be coerced to the correct data type, so passing the string 'true' to a boolean setting will work.

uncategorized:launch.detailedDescription: Lanzar otro programa con unos parámetros dados.

executable.title: Programa
executable.description: El programa que se vaya a lanzar. Debe haber un archivo en el disco. Admite variables en el entorno.

arguments.title: Argumentos
arguments.description: Ningún argumento para pasar al programa.

waitForInputIdle.title: Esperar a que el programa esté listo
waitForInputIdle.description: Espera a que el programa inicie su bucle de mensaje, indicando que el programa está listo.

waitForWindow.title: Ventana de espera
waitForWindow.description: Esperar a que el proceso cree una ventana principal que tenga una clase de ventana que coincida exactamente con este parámetro, o tenga un título de ventana que lo contenga sin tener en cuenta mayúsculas o minúsculas.

waitForExit.title: Esperar a salir del programa
waitForExit.description: Esperar a que el programa termine de ejecutarse antes de continuar.

skipIfAlreadyRunning.title: Do not launch if process is already running
skipIfAlreadyRunning.description: Set this flag if you do not want to run a second instance of this process. If you set this flag, MaxTo will first check to see if the process is already running, and only launch a new process if no existing process can be found. Note that MaxTo will use the full path of the executable to check if the process is running.

bringToFront.title: Traer al frente
bringToFront.description: Forzar a que la ventana se convierta en ventana en primer plano. Podría resultar útil cuando se utiliza en combinación con otros comandos.

timeout.title: Contador en segundos
timeout.description: Cuánto esperar a que el programa esté listo o a que cierre. Tenga en cuenta que, si especifica tanto esperar a que esté listo como esperar a que se cierre, el tiempo total de espera puede ser el doble del valor indicado.

window.description:
Sélectionne par défaut la fenêtre actuellement au premier plan.

Vous pouvez trouver des fenêtres en spécifiant leur nom exact, leur type exact, le descripteur de fenêtre (en hexadécimal, au format "0xdeadbeef").

virtualDesktop.title: Bureau virtuel
virtualDesktop.description: Le numéro de bureau virtuel vers lequel déplacer la fenêtre. Le bureau virtuel actif va changer par répercussions.

region.title: Région
region.description:
Dans quelle région faut-il placer la fenêtre ?

Spécifiez les régions en utilisant des coordonnées relatives au moniteur, séparées par une virgule, à partir de 0,0 pour le coin supérieur gauche. Le premier numéro correspond à la position sur l'axe des X, le second à l'axe des Y.

Vous pouvez spécifier des unités, par exemple "30px, 50%" pour 30px du bord gauche, 50% du haut. Les unités prises en compte sont px et %.

Des mots anglais spécifiques sont également reconnus, vous pouvez donc indiquer "bottom right" ou "center" comme valeurs.

region.title: Region
region.description:
Which region should the window be put in?

Specify regions by using monitor-relative coordinates separated by a comma, starting at 0,0 for the top left corner. The first number is position on the X-axis, the second is Y-axis.

You can specify units, e.g. "30px,50%" for 30px from the left edge, 50% from the top. The supported units are px and %.

Specific English words are also recognized, so you can put "bottom right" or "center" as values here.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

virtualDesktop.title: Virtual desktop
virtualDesktop.description: The virtual desktop number to move the window to. The active virtual desktop will switch as a side effect.

region.title: Region
region.description:
Which region should the window be put in?

Specify regions by using monitor-relative coordinates separated by a comma, starting at 0,0 for the top left corner. The first number is position on the X-axis, the second is Y-axis.

You can specify units, e.g. "30px,50%" for 30px from the left edge, 50% from the top. The supported units are px and %.

Specific English words are also recognized, so you can put "bottom right" or "center" as values here.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description:
Defaults to the monitor the window is currently on.

You can find monitors by specifying their number, their monitor handle (HMONITOR, as hexadecimal, formatted as 0xdeadbeef), or by their exact device name ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serial number or friendly name.

direction.description: Which direction to move the window.

window:transparency.description: Set the transparency of a window.
window:transparency.detailedDescription:
Set the transparency of a selected window.

Note that changing the window transparency can make a window unusable (because you cannot see things that are really there), and should be used with caution. If you accidentally set a window to be transparent when you didn't mean to, the transparency will disappear whenever the affected window is closed and reopened.

amount.title: Transparency amount
amount.description: How transparent should the window be? Ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (completely opaque).

ui:notify.description: Show a notification bubble to the end user.
ui:notify.detailedDescription: Shows a notification bubble in the notification area (Action Center on Windows 10) with a custom title and text.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the notification bubble.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text of the notification bubble.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the message. This affects the display style of the message.

settings:set.detailedDescription: Change a MaxTo setting. You can only change simple settings, such as numbers, strings or boolean values.

setting.title: Setting
setting.description: Which setting to toggle. Should be a path into the config.json structure, separated by periods; e.g. behavior.passiveMode.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Quickly turn on, off or toggle boolean values.

value.title: Value
value.description: Must be a valid value for the setting you are setting. Values will be attempted to be coerced to the correct data type, so passing the string 'true' to a boolean setting will work.

uncategorized:launch.detailedDescription: Launch another program with a given set of parameters.

executable.title: Program
executable.description: The program to launch. Must be a file on disk. Environment variables are supported.

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: Any arguments to pass to the program.

waitForInputIdle.title: Wait for program to be ready
waitForInputIdle.description: Waits for the program to start its message loop, indicating that the program is ready.

waitForWindow.title: Window to wait for
waitForWindow.description: Wait for the process to create a main window that has a window class that matches this parameter exactly, or has a window title that case-insensitively contains this parameter.

waitForExit.title: Wait for program to exit
waitForExit.description: Wait for the program to finish executing before continuing.

skipIfAlreadyRunning.title: Do not launch if process is already running
skipIfAlreadyRunning.description: Set this flag if you do not want to run a second instance of this process. If you set this flag, MaxTo will first check to see if the process is already running, and only launch a new process if no existing process can be found. Note that MaxTo will use the full path of the executable to check if the process is running.

bringToFront.title: Bring to front
bringToFront.description: Force the window to be the foreground window. May be useful when used in combination with other commands.

timeout.title: Timeout in seconds
timeout.description: How long to wait when waiting for program to be ready or for it to exit. Note that if you specify both to wait for the program to be ready and for it to exit, the total wait time can be two times the timeout value.

license:apply.description: 라이센스 키를 사용해서 MaxTo를 즉시 등록합니다

license:status.description: 현재 라이센스에 대한 상세사항을 받아옵니다. 라이센스 키는 반환되지 않습니다.
license:status.detailedDescription: 현재 라이센스에 대한 상세사항을 받아옵니다. 라이센스 키는 반환되지 않습니다.

monitor.title: 모니터
monitor.description:
현재 작동 중인 윈도우를 모니터링하는 것을 기본값으로 설정합니다.

숫자, 모니터 핸들(HMONITOR, 헥사데시멀값, 0xdeadbeef 포멧) 또는 정확한 기기명("\\.\DISPLAY1"), 시리얼 번호 또는 별칭을 명시해서 모니터들을 찾을 수 있습니다.

regions:cycle.description: Load the next preset from a preset cycle.
regions:cycle.detailedDescription: Allows you to quickly cycle through a set of presets through repeated invocations with the same parameters.

presets.title: Presets
presets.description: The presets to cycle through (separated by comma on the command line).

모든 모니터의 기본값.

timeout.title: 밀리 초 단위의 시간 제한
timeout.description: 강조 표시를 숨기기 전에 대기할 밀리 초 단위 시간입니다.

mouse:position.description: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.
mouse:position.detailedDescription: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.

position.title: Position
position.description: Coordinates where the mouse cursor should be placed. Accepts absolute units (pixels) or relative units (percent). In case of relative units, they are measured relative to either the entire desktop, the selected monitor or the selected window.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: The monitor to place the mouse cursor relative to.

window.title: Window
window.description:
The window to place the mouse cursor relative to. Defaults to no window.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

window:move.detailedDescription: 형재 전면 창(또는 /Window 스위치를 사용하는 특정 창)을 이동하세요.

window.title: 창
window.description:
현재 전면 창의 기본값.

정확한 창 제목, 정확한 창 분류 또는 "0xdeadbeef" 형식의 창 핸들(16 진수)을 기준으로 창을 찾을 수 있습니다.

virtualDesktop.title: 가상 데스크톱
virtualDesktop.description: 창을 이동할 가상 데스크톱 번호. 활성 가상 데스크톱이 부작용으로 전환됩니다.

region.title: 지역
region.description:
어떤 영역을 창에 넣어야 합니까?

쉼표로 구분된 모니터 기준 좌표를 사용하여 영역을 지정하세요. 맨 위 왼쪽 모서리는 0,0에서 시작합니다. 첫 번째 숫자는 X축의 위치이고, 두 번째 숫자는 Y축의 위치입니다.

단위를 지정할 수 있습니다. 예:  "30px, 50%"는 좌측 상단에서 30px, 상단에서 50%. 지원되는 단위는 px와 %입니다.

특정 영어 단어도 인식되므로, "bottom right" 또는 "center"를 값으로 사용할 수 있습니다.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Accepts a list of relative rectangles, separated by pipe characters.

number.title: Position number
number.description: Allow you always select a specific position number. E.g. the top left position has 3 possible placements that it cycles between. Specifying "2" here will disable cycling and always select the last position (top left, two thirds wide).

window:contract.detailedDescription: Resize the window by contracting a window edge.

window.title: Window
window.description:
Defaults to the current foreground window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

edge.title: Edge
edge.description: Which edge of the window should be moved?

to.title: To
to.description: Which edges should the contraction stop at? Valid values are Screen, Monitor and Window.

window:center.detailedDescription: 창 크기를 변경하지 않고 현재 모니터 또는 지정된 모니터에서 현재 전면(또는 /Window 스위치를 사용하는 특정 창)을 중앙에 맞춥니다.

monitor.title: 모니터
monitor.description:
현재 창이 표시된 모니터의 기본값.

모니터 번호, 모니터 핸들(HMONITOR, 16 진수, 0xdeadbeef 형식) 또는 정확한 장치 이름("\\.\DISPLAY1"), 일련 번호 또는 친숙한 이름을 지정하여 모니터를 찾을 수 있습니다.

window.title: 창
window.description:
현재 전면 창의 기본값.

정확한 창 제목, 정확한 창 분류, 또는 "0xdeadbeef" 형식의 창 핸들(16 진수)을 기준으로 창을 찾을 수 있습니다.

window:transparency.description: Set the transparency of a window.
window:transparency.detailedDescription:
Set the transparency of a selected window.

Note that changing the window transparency can make a window unusable (because you cannot see things that are really there), and should be used with caution. If you accidentally set a window to be transparent when you didn't mean to, the transparency will disappear whenever the affected window is closed and reopened.

amount.title: Transparency amount
amount.description: How transparent should the window be? Ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (completely opaque).

window.title: Window
window.description:

value.description: Must be a valid value for the setting you are setting. Values will be attempted to be coerced to the correct data type, so passing the string 'true' to a boolean setting will work.

uncategorized:launch.detailedDescription: 주어진 파라미터 셋으로 다른 프로그램을 실행합니다.

executable.title: 프로그램
executable.description: 실행할 프로그램. 디스크 상의 파일이어야 합니다. 환경 변수가 지원됩니다.

waitForInputIdle.title: 프로그램이 준비되기를 기다려 주세요
waitForInputIdle.description: 프로그램이 메시지 루프를 시작하며, 준비가 되면 표시해주기를 기다려 주세요.

waitForWindow.title: 대기 윈도우
waitForWindow.description: 프로세스가 이 파라미터에 정확히 일치하는 윈도우 클래스를 가졌거나,  이 파라미터를 대소문자 구분없이 포함한 윈도우를 가진 메인 윈도우를 생성하기를 기다려 주세요.

waitForExit.title: 프로그램이 종료되기를 기다려 주세요
waitForExit.description: 계속 진행하시기 전에 프로그램이 종료되기를 기다려 주세요.

skipIfAlreadyRunning.title: Do not launch if process is already running
skipIfAlreadyRunning.description: Set this flag if you do not want to run a second instance of this process. If you set this flag, MaxTo will first check to see if the process is already running, and only launch a new process if no existing process can be found. Note that MaxTo will use the full path of the executable to check if the process is running.

bringToFront.title: 앞으로 가져오기
bringToFront.description: 윈도우를 강제로 전경 윈도우가 되도록 합니다. 다른 명령어와 함께 사용될 때 유용할 수 있습니다.

timeout.title: 타임아웃(초)
timeout.description: 프로그램이 준비 또는 종료되기 위해서 기다려야 하는 시간입니다. 프로그램 준비 및 종료를 모두 명시하실 경우, 총 대기 시간이 두배가 될 수 있음을 양지하시기 바랍니다.

regions:apply.description: Laster en mal på en skjerm
regions:apply.detailedDescription: Last en mal på den skjermen du ønsker.

monitor.title: Skjerm
monitor.description:
Bruker skjermen som vinduet med fokus som standard.

Du kan finne skjermer ved å oppgi deres nummer, skjermreferanse (HMONITOR, som hexadesimal, formattert 0xdeadbeef), eller ved å bruke eksakt navn ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serienummer eller visningsnavn.

name.title: Mal
name.description: Navnet på malen du vil laste.

regions:cycle.description: Load the next preset from a preset cycle.
regions:cycle.detailedDescription: Allows you to quickly cycle through a set of presets through repeated invocations with the same parameters.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description:
Defaults to the monitor the window is currently on.

You can find monitors by specifying their number, their monitor handle (HMONITOR, as hexadecimal, formatted as 0xdeadbeef), or by their exact device name ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serial number or friendly name.

presets.title: Presets
presets.description: The presets to cycle through (separated by comma on the command line).

regions:highlight.description: Vis aktive regioner i en kort periode
regions:highlight.detailedDescription: Bruk dette for å raskt få et overblikk over de aktive regionene.

monitor.title: Skjerm
monitor.description:
Bruker alle skjermer som standard.

Du kan finne en skjerm ved å angi nummeret, skjermreferansen (HMONITOR, som heksadesimalt tall, formatert som 0xdeadbeef), eller ved dens nøyaktige enhetsnavn ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serienummer eller visningsnavn.

timeout.title: Tidsavbrudd i millisekunder
timeout.description: Antall millisekunder det skal ventes før uthevingen skjules.

mouse:position.description: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.
mouse:position.detailedDescription: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.

position.title: Position
position.description: Coordinates where the mouse cursor should be placed. Accepts absolute units (pixels) or relative units (percent). In case of relative units, they are measured relative to either the entire desktop, the selected monitor or the selected window.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: The monitor to place the mouse cursor relative to.

window.title: Window
window.description:
The window to place the mouse cursor relative to. Defaults to no window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

window:move.detailedDescription: Flytter forgrunnsvinduet (eller et spesifikt vindu ved å bruke /Window).

window.title: Vindu
window.description:
Bruker forgrunnsvinduet som standard.

Du kan finne vinduer ved å bruke nøyaktig vindustittel, nøyaktig vindusklasse eller vindusreferansen (som heksadesimalt tall, formatert som "0xdeadbeef").

virtualDesktop.title: Virtuelt skrivebord
virtualDesktop.description: Nummeret til det virtuelle skriveborder du vil flytte vinduet til. Det aktive virtuelle skrivebordet byttes som en bivirkning.

region.title: Region
region.description:
Hvilket område skal vinduet settes i?

Angi områder ved hjelp av skjerm-relative koordinater atskilt med komma, der 0,0 tilsvarer øvre venstre hjørne. Det første tallet er posisjon på x-aksen, andre er y-aksen.

Du kan angi enheter, f.eks "30px, 50%" for 30px fra venstre kant, 50% fra toppen. De støttede enhetene er px og %.

Bestemte (engelske) ord er også anerkjent, så du kan bruke verdier som "bottom right" eller "center" her.

monitor.title: Skjerm
monitor.description:
Bruker skjermen som vinduet er på som standard.

Du kan finne en skjerm ved å angi nummeret, skjermreferansen (HMONITOR, som heksadesimalt tall, formatert som 0xdeadbeef), eller ved dens nøyaktige enhetsnavn ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serienummer eller visningsnavn.

direction.title: Hvilken retning vinduet skal flyttes i.

window.title: Window
window.description:

origin.title: Origin

window:maximize.description: Maksimere et vindu på hele skjermen.
window:maximize.detailedDescription: Maksimerer et bestemt vindu til hele skjermen det er på, la Windows' naturlige maksimering skje.

window.title:
Hvilket vindu skal brukes? Faller tilbake på forgrunnsvinduet.

Du kan finne vindu ved å søke på eksakt tittel, exakt vindusklasse, eller vindushåndtak (handle, oppgitt i hexadesimal, formattert "0xdeadbeef")
window.description:
Bruker forgrunnsvinduet som standard.

Du kan finne vinduer ved å bruke nøyaktig vindustittel, nøyaktig vindusklasse eller vindusreferansen (som heksadesimalt tall, formatert som "0xdeadbeef").

monitor.title: Skjerm
monitor.description: Bruker skjermen med det aktive vinduet som standard. Du kan finne en skjerm ved å angi nummeret, skjermreferansen (HMONITOR, som heksadesimalt tall, formatert som 0xdeadbeef), eller ved dens nøyaktige enhetsnavn ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serienummer eller visningsnavn.

window:focus.detailedDescription: Flytter fokus til et vindu i en bestemt retning.

window.title: Vindu
window.description:
Vinduet du vil motta skal motta fokus. Hvis retningen angis i tillegg til dette, angir det vinduet du bruker startpunktet.

Du kan finne vinduer ved å bruke nøyaktig vindustittel, nøyaktig vindusklasse eller vindusreferansen (som heksadesimalt tall, formatert som "0xdeadbeef").

region.title: Region
region.description: The region you want to search for the window. The window has to be maximized to this region.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: The monitor you want to search for the window. The window has to be partially covering this monitor's working area to be included.

mouse:position.description: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.
mouse:position.detailedDescription: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.

position.title: Position
position.description: Coordinates where the mouse cursor should be placed. Accepts absolute units (pixels) or relative units (percent). In case of relative units, they are measured relative to either the entire desktop, the selected monitor or the selected window.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: The monitor to place the mouse cursor relative to.

window.title: Window
window.description:
The window to place the mouse cursor relative to. Defaults to no window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

window:move.detailedDescription: Moves the current foreground window (or a specific window using the /Window switch).

window.description:

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

virtualDesktop.title: Virtual desktop
virtualDesktop.description: The virtual desktop number to move the window to. The active virtual desktop will switch as a side effect.

region.title: Region
region.description:
Which region should the window be put in?

Specify regions by using monitor-relative coordinates separated by a comma, starting at 0,0 for the top left corner. The first number is position on the X-axis, the second is Y-axis.

You can specify units, e.g. "30px,50%" for 30px from the left edge, 50% from the top. The supported units are px and %.

Specific English words are also recognized, so you can put "bottom right" or "center" as values here.

window:transparency.description: Set the transparency of a window.
window:transparency.detailedDescription:
Set the transparency of a selected window.

Note that changing the window transparency can make a window unusable (because you cannot see things that are really there), and should be used with caution. If you accidentally set a window to be transparent when you didn't mean to, the transparency will disappear whenever the affected window is closed and reopened.

amount.description: How transparent should the window be? Ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (completely opaque).

title.description: The title of the notification bubble.

setting.description: Which setting to toggle. Should be a path into the config.json structure, separated by periods; e.g. behavior.passiveMode.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Quickly turn on, off or toggle boolean values.

value.title: Value
value.description: Must be a valid value for the setting you are setting. Values will be attempted to be coerced to the correct data type, so passing the string 'true' to a boolean setting will work.

uncategorized:launch.detailedDescription: Launch another program with a given set of parameters.

executable.title: Program
executable.description: The program to launch. Must be a file on disk. Environment variables are supported.

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: Any arguments to pass to the program.

waitForInputIdle.title: Wait for program to be ready
waitForInputIdle.description: Waits for the program to start its message loop, indicating that the program is ready.

waitForWindow.title: Window to wait for
waitForWindow.description: Wait for the process to create a main window that has a window class that matches this parameter exactly, or has a window title that case-insensitively contains this parameter.

waitForExit.title: Wait for program to exit
waitForExit.description: Wait for the program to finish executing before continuing.

skipIfAlreadyRunning.title: Do not launch if process is already running
skipIfAlreadyRunning.description: Set this flag if you do not want to run a second instance of this process. If you set this flag, MaxTo will first check to see if the process is already running, and only launch a new process if no existing process can be found. Note that MaxTo will use the full path of the executable to check if the process is running.

bringToFront.title: Bring to front
bringToFront.description: Force the window to be the foreground window. May be useful when used in combination with other commands.

timeout.title: Timeout in seconds
timeout.description: How long to wait when waiting for program to be ready or for it to exit. Note that if you specify both to wait for the program to be ready and for it to exit, the total wait time can be two times the timeout value.

region.description:
Em qual região a janela deve ser colocada?

Especifique regiões usando coordenadas relativas ao monitor separadas por uma vírgula, iniciando em 0,0 para o canto superior esquerdo. O primeiro número é a posição no eixo X, o segundo é o eixo Y.

Você pode especificar unidades, por exemplo "30px, 50%" para 30px a partir da borda esquerda, 50% a partir do topo. As unidades suportadas são px e%.

Palavras específicas em inglês também são reconhecidas, assim você pode colocar "bottom right" ou "center" como valores aqui.

You can find monitors by specifying their number, their monitor handle (HMONITOR, as hexadecimal, formatted as 0xdeadbeef), or by their exact device name ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serial number or friendly name.

window.title: Window
window.description:
Defaults to the current foreground window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Accepts a list of relative rectangles, separated by pipe characters.

number.title: Position number
number.description: Allow you always select a specific position number. E.g. the top left position has 3 possible placements that it cycles between. Specifying "2" here will disable cycling and always select the last position (top left, two thirds wide).

window:contract.detailedDescription: Resize the window by contracting a window edge.

window.title: Window
window.description:
Defaults to the current foreground window.

edge.title: Edge
edge.description: Which edge of the window should be moved?

to.title: To
to.description: Which edges should the contraction stop at? Valid values are Screen, Monitor and Window.

window:center.detailedDescription: Centraliza o primeiro plano atual (ou uma janela específica usando a opção / Window) no monitor atual ou especificado sem alterar o tamanho da janela.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description:
Padrões para o monitor em que a janela está atualmente.

Você pode encontrar monitores especificando seu número, seu identificador de monitor (HMONITOR, como hexadecimal, formatado como 0xdeadbeef) ou pelo nome exato do dispositivo ("\\. \ DISPLAY1"), número de série ou nome amigável.

window.title: Janela
window.description:
Padrões para a janela atual em primeiro plano.

Você pode encontrar janelas especificando o título exato da janela, a classe exata da janela ou o identificador da janela (em hexadecimal, formatado como "0xdeadbeef").

window:transparency.description: Set the transparency of a window.
window:transparency.detailedDescription:
Set the transparency of a selected window.

Note that changing the window transparency can make a window unusable (because you cannot see things that are really there), and should be used with caution. If you accidentally set a window to be transparent when you didn't mean to, the transparency will disappear whenever the affected window is closed and reopened.

amount.title: Transparency amount
amount.description: How transparent should the window be? Ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (completely opaque).

ui:close.detailedDescription: Close a MaxTo window of your choosing.

window.description: The MaxTo window to close.

ui:notify.detailedDescription: Shows a notification bubble in the notification area (Action Center on Windows 10) with a custom title and text.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the notification bubble.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text of the notification bubble.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the message. This affects the display style of the message.

settings:set.detailedDescription: Change a MaxTo setting. You can only change simple settings, such as numbers, strings or boolean values.

setting.title: Setting
setting.description: Which setting to toggle. Should be a path into the config.json structure, separated by periods; e.g. behavior.passiveMode.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Quickly turn on, off or toggle boolean values.

value.title: Value
value.description: Must be a valid value for the setting you are setting. Values will be attempted to be coerced to the correct data type, so passing the string 'true' to a boolean setting will work.

uncategorized:launch.detailedDescription: Inicia um programa com um conjunto de parâmetros

executable.title: Programa
executable.description: O programa para abrir. Deve ser um arquivo no disco. Variáveis de Ambiente são suportadas.

arguments.title: Argumentos
arguments.description: Qualquer argumento para passar ao programa

waitForInputIdle.title: Aguardar o programa ficar pronto
waitForInputIdle.description: Aguardar o programa iniciar seu loop de mensagem, indicando que o programa está pronto.

waitForWindow.title: Aguardar a janela para
waitForWindow.description: Aguarde o processo criar uma janela principal que tenha uma classe de janela que corresponda exatamente a esse parâmetro ou que tenha um título de janela que insensível a maiúsculas e minúsculas contenha esse parâmetro.

waitForExit.title: Aguardar o programa para sair
waitForExit.description: Aguardar até que o programa concluir a execução antes de continuar.

skipIfAlreadyRunning.title: Do not launch if process is already running
skipIfAlreadyRunning.description: Set this flag if you do not want to run a second instance of this process. If you set this flag, MaxTo will first check to see if the process is already running, and only launch a new process if no existing process can be found. Note that MaxTo will use the full path of the executable to check if the process is running.

bringToFront.title: Trazer para frente
bringToFront.description: Forçar a janela ficar em primeiro plano. Pode ser útil quando usado em combinação com outros comandos.

timeout.title: Tempo limite em segundos
timeout.description: Quanto tempo esperar ao esperar que o programa esteja pronto ou saia. Observe que, se você especificar os dois para aguardar até que o programa esteja pronto e para que ele seja encerrado, o tempo total de espera poderá ser duas vezes o valor de tempo limite.

license:apply.description: Зарегистрируйте MaxTo сейчас при помощи лицензионного ключа
license:apply.detailedDescription: Применяет лицензионный ключ MaxTo прямо сейчас.

license:status.description: Получить подробную информацию о текущей лицензии. Лицензионный ключ не возвращается.
license:status.detailedDescription: Получить подробную информацию о текущей лицензии. Лицензионный ключ не возвращается.

monitor.title: Монитор
monitor.description:
По умолчанию используется монитор, где сейчас находится окно.

Вы можете найти мониторы, указав их номер, идентификатор монитора (HMONITOR, в шестнадцатеричном формате – 0xdeadbeef) или же по их точному имени устройства ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), серийному номеру или же установленному понятному имени.

regions:cycle.description: Load the next preset from a preset cycle.
regions:cycle.detailedDescription: Allows you to quickly cycle through a set of presets through repeated invocations with the same parameters.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description:
Defaults to the monitor the window is currently on.

You can find monitors by specifying their number, their monitor handle (HMONITOR, as hexadecimal, formatted as 0xdeadbeef), or by their exact device name ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serial number or friendly name.

presets.title: Presets
presets.description: The presets to cycle through (separated by comma on the command line).

regions:highlight.description: Выделите активные области на непродолжительное время
regions:highlight.detailedDescription: Используйте это для оперативного получения анализа по активным в данный момент областям.

monitor.title: Монитор
monitor.description:
Значения по умолчанию для всех мониторов.

Вы можете отыскать мониторы, указав их номер, обработчика монитора (HMONITOR, как шестнадцатеричный код, отформатированный как 0xdeadbeef), точное название устройства ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), серийный номер или понятное имя.

timeout.title: Время ожидания в миллисекундах
timeout.description: Сколько миллисекунд нужно подождать прежде, чем скрыть выделенное.

mouse:position.description: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.
mouse:position.detailedDescription: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.

position.title: Position
position.description: Coordinates where the mouse cursor should be placed. Accepts absolute units (pixels) or relative units (percent). In case of relative units, they are measured relative to either the entire desktop, the selected monitor or the selected window.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: The monitor to place the mouse cursor relative to.

window.title: Window
window.description:
The window to place the mouse cursor relative to. Defaults to no window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

window:move.detailedDescription: Перемещает текущее окно переднего плана (или конкретное окно, используя переключатель /Окон).

window.title: Окно
window.description:
Значения по умолчанию для текущего окна переднего плана.

Вы можете отыскать окно, указав его точное название, точный класс окна или его обработчика (как шестнадцатеричный код, отформатированный как "0xdeadbeef").

virtualDesktop.title: Виртуальный рабочий стол
virtualDesktop.description: Номер виртуального рабочего стола, на который нужно перенести окно. Активный виртуальный рабочий стол будет включен как побочный эффект.

region.title: Область
region.description:
В какую область следует переместить окно?

Укажите регионы, используя связанные с монитором координаты, разделенные запятыми, начиная с 0,0 для левого верхнего угла. Первое число – позиция на оси X, второе – на оси Y.

Вы можете указать единицы измерения, напр., "30px,50%" для 30px от левого края, 50% от верха. Поддерживаемые единицы – px и %.

Определенные слова английского языка также распознаются, так что вы можете ввести здесь "bottom right" или "center" в качестве значений.

monitor.title: Монитор

direction.title: Направление

skipIfAlreadyRunning.title: Do not launch if process is already running
skipIfAlreadyRunning.description: Set this flag if you do not want to run a second instance of this process. If you set this flag, MaxTo will first check to see if the process is already running, and only launch a new process if no existing process can be found. Note that MaxTo will use the full path of the executable to check if the process is running.

bringToFront.title: На передний план
bringToFront.description: Принудительно перевести окно на передний план. Может быть полезно при использовании в сочетании с другими командами.

timeout.title: Время ожидания в секундах
timeout.description: Как долго нужно ждать готовности или завершения программы. Обратите внимание, что если вы укажете и время ожидание готовности программы, и время ожидания завершение, то общее время ожидания может быть в два раза больше указанного значения.

license:status.description: Získať detaily o súčasnej licencii. Licenčný kľúč nebude zobrazený.

monitor.title: Obraz.
monitor.description:
Východzie nastavenie pre obrazovku, na ktorej je aktuálne aktívne okno.

Obrazovky môžete odlíšiť cez ich číslo, ich popisovač (HMONITOR ako hexadecimálne číslo, formátované ako 0xdeadbeef) alebo cez názov zariadenia ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), sériové číslo alebo názov.

regions:cycle.description: Load the next preset from a preset cycle.
regions:cycle.detailedDescription: Allows you to quickly cycle through a set of presets through repeated invocations with the same parameters.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description:
Defaults to the monitor the window is currently on.

You can find monitors by specifying their number, their monitor handle (HMONITOR, as hexadecimal, formatted as 0xdeadbeef), or by their exact device name ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serial number or friendly name.

presets.title: Presets
presets.description: The presets to cycle through (separated by comma on the command line).

regions:highlight.description: Zvýrazniť aktívne oblasti na obmedzený čas
regions:highlight.detailedDescription: Použite toto na rýchle získanie prehľadu o teraz aktívnych oblastiach.

monitor.title: Obraz.

Východzie nastavenie pre všetky obrazovky.

timeout.title: Časový interval (v ms)
timeout.description: Počet ms pred skrytím zvýraznenia.

mouse:position.description: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.
mouse:position.detailedDescription: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.

position.title: Position
position.description: Coordinates where the mouse cursor should be placed. Accepts absolute units (pixels) or relative units (percent). In case of relative units, they are measured relative to either the entire desktop, the selected monitor or the selected window.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: The monitor to place the mouse cursor relative to.

window.title: Window
window.description:
The window to place the mouse cursor relative to. Defaults to no window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

window:move.detailedDescription: Presunúť terajšie okno na popredí (alebo upresniť okno použitím parametra /Window).

window.title: Okno
window.description:
Východzie nastavenie pre aktívne okno v popredí.

Okná môžete odlíšiť cez nadpis okna, presný názov triedy okna alebo cez popisovač okna (ako hexadecimálne číslo, formátované ako "0xdeadbeef").

virtualDesktop.title: Virtuál. plocha
virtualDesktop.description: Číslo virtuálnej plochy, do ktorej presunúť okno. Súčasne sa zmení aktívna virtuálna plocha.

region.title: Oblasť
region.description:
V ktorej oblasti má byť okno umiestnené?

Upresni oblasti použitím súradníc oddelených čiarkou, začínajúcich 0,0 pre ľavý horný roh. Prvé číslo je pozíciou na osi X, druhé na osi Y.

Môžete upresniť jednotky, napr. "30px,50%" pre 30px z ľavého okraja a 50% z horného okraja. Podporované jednotky sú px a %.

Vybrané anglické slová sú taktiež rozpoznané, takže môžete napísať "bottom right" alebo "center" namiesto presných súradníc.

window:transparency.description: Set the transparency of a window.
window:transparency.detailedDescription:
Set the transparency of a selected window.

Note that changing the window transparency can make a window unusable (because you cannot see things that are really there), and should be used with caution. If you accidentally set a window to be transparent when you didn't mean to, the transparency will disappear whenever the affected window is closed and reopened.

amount.title: Transparency amount
amount.description: How transparent should the window be? Ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (completely opaque).

region.title: Region
region.description:
Which region should the window be put in?

Specify regions by using monitor-relative coordinates separated by a comma, starting at 0,0 for the top left corner. The first number is position on the X-axis, the second is Y-axis.

You can specify units, e.g. "30px,50%" for 30px from the left edge, 50% from the top. The supported units are px and %.

Specific English words are also recognized, so you can put "bottom right" or "center" as values here.

window:fit.detailedDescription: Fits windows to the currently closest regions.

windows.title: Windows
windows.description:
Defaults to all maximizable, non-minimized windows.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: Only fit the windows whose current position intersects with this monitors bounds.

window:expand.detailedDescription: Resize the window by expanding a window edge.

window.title: Window
window.description:
Defaults to the current foreground window.

edge.title: Edge
edge.description: Which edge of the window should be moved?

to.title: To
to.description: Which edges should the expansion stop at? Valid values are Screen, Monitor and Window.

window:cycle-position.description: Cycle a window through a given list of positions.
window:cycle-position.detailedDescription: Emulates WinSplit Revolution behavior to quickly place a window in specific positions of the monitor by cycling the position through a given set of positions on repeated invocations.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description:
Defaults to the monitor the window is currently on.

You can find monitors by specifying their number, their monitor handle (HMONITOR, as hexadecimal, formatted as 0xdeadbeef), or by their exact device name ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serial number or friendly name.

window.title: Window
window.description:
Defaults to the current foreground window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Accepts a list of relative rectangles, separated by pipe characters.

number.title: Position number
number.description: Allow you always select a specific position number. E.g. the top left position has 3 possible placements that it cycles between. Specifying "2" here will disable cycling and always select the last position (top left, two thirds wide).

window:contract.detailedDescription: Resize the window by contracting a window edge.

window:transparency.description: Set the transparency of a window.
window:transparency.detailedDescription:
Set the transparency of a selected window.

Note that changing the window transparency can make a window unusable (because you cannot see things that are really there), and should be used with caution. If you accidentally set a window to be transparent when you didn't mean to, the transparency will disappear whenever the affected window is closed and reopened.

amount.title: Transparency amount
amount.description: How transparent should the window be? Ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (completely opaque).

mode.title: Mode

ui:open.detailedDescription: Open a MaxTo window of your choosing.

window.title: Window
window.description: The MaxTo window to open.

ui:close.detailedDescription: Close a MaxTo window of your choosing.

window.title: Window
window.description: The MaxTo window to close.

ui:notify.description: Show a notification bubble to the end user.
ui:notify.detailedDescription: Shows a notification bubble in the notification area (Action Center on Windows 10) with a custom title and text.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the notification bubble.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text of the notification bubble.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the message. This affects the display style of the message.

settings:set.detailedDescription: Change a MaxTo setting. You can only change simple settings, such as numbers, strings or boolean values.

setting.title: Setting
setting.description: Which setting to toggle. Should be a path into the config.json structure, separated by periods; e.g. behavior.passiveMode.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Quickly turn on, off or toggle boolean values.

value.title: Value
value.description: Must be a valid value for the setting you are setting. Values will be attempted to be coerced to the correct data type, so passing the string 'true' to a boolean setting will work.

uncategorized:launch.detailedDescription: Launch another program with a given set of parameters.

executable.title: Program
executable.description: The program to launch. Must be a file on disk. Environment variables are supported.

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: Any arguments to pass to the program.

waitForInputIdle.title: Wait for program to be ready
waitForInputIdle.description: Waits for the program to start its message loop, indicating that the program is ready.

waitForWindow.title: Window to wait for
waitForWindow.description: Wait for the process to create a main window that has a window class that matches this parameter exactly, or has a window title that case-insensitively contains this parameter.

waitForExit.title: Wait for program to exit
waitForExit.description: Wait for the program to finish executing before continuing.

skipIfAlreadyRunning.title: Do not launch if process is already running
skipIfAlreadyRunning.description: Set this flag if you do not want to run a second instance of this process. If you set this flag, MaxTo will first check to see if the process is already running, and only launch a new process if no existing process can be found. Note that MaxTo will use the full path of the executable to check if the process is running.

bringToFront.title: Bring to front
bringToFront.description: Force the window to be the foreground window. May be useful when used in combination with other commands.

timeout.title: Timeout in seconds
timeout.description: How long to wait when waiting for program to be ready or for it to exit. Note that if you specify both to wait for the program to be ready and for it to exit, the total wait time can be two times the timeout value.

license:apply.description: 使用许可秘钥立刻注册 MaxTo
license:apply.detailedDescription: 立刻使用 MaxTo 许可秘钥。

license:status.description: 得到当前许可的详细信息。不返回许可秘钥。
license:status.detailedDescription: 得到当前许可的详细信息。不返回许可秘钥。
license:status.displayName: 检查 MaxTo 是否被许可使用

timeout.title: 超时时间（毫秒）

mouse:position.description: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.
mouse:position.detailedDescription: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.

position.title: Position
position.description: Coordinates where the mouse cursor should be placed. Accepts absolute units (pixels) or relative units (percent). In case of relative units, they are measured relative to either the entire desktop, the selected monitor or the selected window.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: The monitor to place the mouse cursor relative to.

window.title: Window
window.description:
The window to place the mouse cursor relative to. Defaults to no window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

window:move.detailedDescription: Moves the current foreground window (or a specific window using the /Window switch).

window.title: 窗口
window.description:
Defaults to the current foreground window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

virtualDesktop.title: 虚拟桌面
virtualDesktop.description: The virtual desktop number to move the window to. The active virtual desktop will switch as a side effect.

region.title: 区域
region.description:
Which region should the window be put in?

Specify regions by using monitor-relative coordinates separated by a comma, starting at 0,0 for the top left corner. The first number is position on the X-axis, the second is Y-axis.

You can specify units, e.g. "30px,50%" for 30px from the left edge, 50% from the top. The supported units are px and %.

Specific English words are also recognized, so you can put "bottom right" or "center" as values here.

monitor.title: 显示器

monitor.title: Monitor

Defaults to the monitor the window is currently on.

name.title: Preset name

regions:cycle.description: Load the next preset from a preset cycle.
regions:cycle.detailedDescription: Allows you to quickly cycle through a set of presets through repeated invocations with the same parameters.

presets.title: Presets

regions:highlight.description: Highlight the active regions for a short time
regions:highlight.detailedDescription: Use this to quickly get an overview over the currently active regions.

monitor.title: Monitor

timeout.title: Timeout in milliseconds
timeout.description: Number of milliseconds to wait before hiding the highlight.

mouse:position.description: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.
mouse:position.detailedDescription: Move the mouse cursor to a specific position, window or monitor.

position.title: Position
position.description: Coordinates where the mouse cursor should be placed. Accepts absolute units (pixels) or relative units (percent). In case of relative units, they are measured relative to either the entire desktop, the selected monitor or the selected window.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description: The monitor to place the mouse cursor relative to.

window.title: Window
window.description:
The window to place the mouse cursor relative to. Defaults to no window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

window:move.detailedDescription: Moves the current foreground window (or a specific window using the /Window switch).

window.title: Window
window.description:
Defaults to the current foreground window.

Find windows by searching for the process name, window class and window title. All parts support wildcards or regular expressions. When setting up this command in the user interface, a nice editor is provided for the separate parts.

When searching from the command line, the syntax is: \[process name]\[window class]\[window title]. All parts are optional, meaning you can use "\\\Untitled - Notepad" to find the window with that title.

Wildcards are supported for each part. You can use regular expressions by surrounding the part with forwards slashes: "\\\/.* - Notepad/" will find any Notepad window, and is equivalent to "\\\* - Notepad".

virtualDesktop.title: Virtual desktop
virtualDesktop.description: The virtual desktop number to move the window to. The active virtual desktop will switch as a side effect.

region.title: Region
region.description:
Which region should the window be put in?

Specify regions by using monitor-relative coordinates separated by a comma, starting at 0,0 for the top left corner. The first number is position on the X-axis, the second is Y-axis.

You can specify units, e.g. "30px,50%" for 30px from the left edge, 50% from the top. The supported units are px and %.

Specific English words are also recognized, so you can put "bottom right" or "center" as values here.

monitor.title: Monitor
monitor.description:
Defaults to the monitor the window is currently on.

You can find monitors by specifying their number, their monitor handle (HMONITOR, as hexadecimal, formatted as 0xdeadbeef), or by their exact device name ("\\.\DISPLAY1"), serial number or friendly name.

direction.title: Direction
direction.description: Which direction to move the window.

swap.title: Swap with windows in destination region

number.title: Position number

window:transparency.description: Set the transparency of a window.
window:transparency.detailedDescription:
Set the transparency of a selected window.

Note that changing the window transparency can make a window unusable (because you cannot see things that are really there), and should be used with caution. If you accidentally set a window to be transparent when you didn't mean to, the transparency will disappear whenever the affected window is closed and reopened.

amount.title: Transparency amount
amount.description: How transparent should the window be? Ranges from 0 (completely transparent) to 255 (completely opaque).

ui:open.detailedDescription: Open a MaxTo window of your choosing.

window.title: Window
window.description: The MaxTo window to open.

ui:close.detailedDescription: Close a MaxTo window of your choosing.

window.title: Window
window.description: The MaxTo window to close.

ui:notify.description: Show a notification bubble to the end user.
ui:notify.detailedDescription: Shows a notification bubble in the notification area (Action Center on Windows 10) with a custom title and text.

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the notification bubble.

text.title: Text
text.description: The text of the notification bubble.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the message. This affects the display style of the message.

settings:set.detailedDescription: Change a MaxTo setting. You can only change simple settings, such as numbers, strings or boolean values.

setting.title: Setting
setting.description: Which setting to toggle. Should be a path into the config.json structure, separated by periods; e.g. behavior.passiveMode.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Quickly turn on, off or toggle boolean values.

value.title: Value
value.description: Must be a valid value for the setting you are setting. Values will be attempted to be coerced to the correct data type, so passing the string 'true' to a boolean setting will work.

uncategorized:launch.detailedDescription: Launch another program with a given set of parameters.

executable.title: Program
executable.description: The program to launch. Must be a file on disk. Environment variables are supported.

arguments.title: Arguments
arguments.description: Any arguments to pass to the program.

waitForInputIdle.title: Wait for program to be ready
waitForInputIdle.description: Waits for the program to start its message loop, indicating that the program is ready.

waitForWindow.title: Window to wait for
waitForWindow.description: Wait for the process to create a main window that has a window class that matches this parameter exactly, or has a window title that case-insensitively contains this parameter.

waitForExit.title: Wait for program to exit
waitForExit.description: Wait for the program to finish executing before continuing.

skipIfAlreadyRunning.title: Do not launch if process is already running
skipIfAlreadyRunning.description: Set this flag if you do not want to run a second instance of this process. If you set this flag, MaxTo will first check to see if the process is already running, and only launch a new process if no existing process can be found. Note that MaxTo will use the full path of the executable to check if the process is running.

bringToFront.title: Bring to front
bringToFront.description: Force the window to be the foreground window. May be useful when used in combination with other commands.

timeout.title: Timeout in seconds
timeout.description: How long to wait when waiting for program to be ready or for it to exit. Note that if you specify both to wait for the program to be ready and for it to exit, the total wait time can be two times the timeout value.

license:apply.detailedDescription: Applies a MaxTo license key immediately.

license:status.description: Get the details about the current license. License key is not returned.
license:status.detailedDescription: Get the details about the current license. License key is not returned.
